rescuecore2.standard.entities

Class StandardWorldModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • rescuecore2.worldmodel.AbstractWorldModel<T>
      • rescuecore2.worldmodel.DefaultWorldModel<StandardEntity>
        • rescuecore2.standard.entities.StandardWorldModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<StandardEntity>, WorldModel<StandardEntity>

    public class StandardWorldModel
extends DefaultWorldModel<StandardEntity>
    A wrapper around a WorldModel that indexes Entities by location.

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        public void merge(ChangeSet changeSet)
        Description copied from interface: WorldModel
        Merge a set of changes into this world. If the ChangeSet specifies that a property has become undefined then the existing property WILL become undefined. This behaviour is different to the WorldModel.merge(Collection) method because an undefined value inside a ChangeSet means that the property value has become undefined, whereas in the other version of merge an undefined property means there is no value for that property.
        Specified by:
        merge in interface WorldModel<StandardEntity>
        Overrides:
        merge in class AbstractWorldModel<StandardEntity>
        Parameters:
        changeSet - The set of changes to merge into this world model.

        public int getDistance(EntityID first,

        Get the distance between two entities.
        Parameters:

        second - The ID of the second entity.
        Returns:

      • createStandardWorldModel

        public static StandardWorldModel createStandardWorldModel(WorldModel<? extends Entity> existing)
        Create a StandardWorldModel that wraps an existing world model. If the existing model is already a StandardWorldModel then it will be returned directly, otherwise a new StandardWorldModel will be created that contains all the entities in the existing model that are instances of StandardEntity. Changes to the existing world model will be reflected in the returned StandardWorldModel.
        Parameters:
        existing - The existing world model to wrap. This may be null.
        Returns:
        The existing world model if it is an instance of StandardWorldModel; a new model otherwise.
